title: Freljord
body:
So I have a bunch of questions:
1. I am not sure so i am asking, are there jarls or something like that in Freljord?
2. Is war in Freljord similar to civil war in Skyrim where like half of Nords are Stormcloacks and the rest is pro-Imperial, and in Freljord there are Freljordians(?) who fight for Avarosa, some for Sejuani, I am not sure about people supporting Lissandra besides Frostguard tribe and those Clans try to convice  jarls (if they exist), who are neutral at the moment to fight with them?
3. What are Noxus and Demacia thinking about war in Freljord, maybe they are thinking about possibility to invade and easilly take lands while Freljordans are busy with fighting eachother, maybe they have their favourites leaders and are supporting them or they are simply neutral? 
4. What is the current situation of war, who is winning and who is loosing and how the political map of Freljord may look?
I think its all for now. Sorry for my English :D

Would it be accurate to say that Freljord is matriarchal? What about the Barbarian clans like Tryndamere's?
The Freljord is non-hereditary matriarchal.  Barbarian tribes have various systems.  Tryndamere's tribe was patriarchal.

> [{quoted}](name=WAAARGHbobo,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=yUuU1kyI,comment-id=000200040000,timestamp=2016-01-19T04:00:57.884+0000)
>
> The Freljord is non-hereditary matriarchal.  Barbarian tribes have various systems.  Tryndamere's tribe was patriarchal.

Can you define matriarchal for us? What exactly does that entail?
Matriarchal means "ruled by women." Only a woman can lead a clan.

It also goes a bit further in that women in such a culture would dominate the highest positions of power. Basically the opposite of a patriarchy. An animal example is the Spotted Hyena.

For Spotted Hyenas, females are larger and more dominant than males in just about everything, and even the alpha male is surpassed in position by females of the lowest rank. The difference between this and Freljord tribes is that where as WaarghBobo has talked about the system there being non-hereditary that's not the case for Spotted Hyenas; the offspring of high ranking females our rank adults who are subordinate to that mother.

As far as I can gather its such that there are 3 tribes each run by a Queen of their own and they generally left each other alone until recently when Lissandra kicked the hornets nest so as to make way for her ancient masters' return.

Sejuani's tribe lives in the northern part of the land and its mostly tundra, no place to farm and its pretty s**t. Ashe's tribe lives more to the south and its more hospitable. Sejuani wants that land cause well... Its nice.
So Freljord power structure is structured around matriarchal figures, nice to know its not just Ashe, Sejuani and Lissandra.

The Freljord is the best.   I assume they become a world power, or at least on their way to being such, once Tryndamere becomes King of the Freljord.
